 As a Full Stack Web Developer Intern, you will work on live projects while gaining hands\\-on experience in both front\\-end and back\\-end development. This role is designed to enhance your technical skills and prepare you for a professional career in full\\-stack web development.

title: Full-Stack Engineer (GraphQL, NestJS, Next.js) ‚Äì India / Remote
description:
**üöÄ We‚Äôre Hiring: Full\\-Stack Engineer (GraphQL, NestJS, Next.js) ‚Äì India / Remote** 




**Company:** 

 Novologic
 




**Industry:** 

 Construction Technology (Data, AI, Project Intelligence)
 




**Employment Type:** 

 Full\\-time
 





 Novologic is building next\\-generation software that transforms complex construction project data into actionable, predictive insights. Our platform powers advanced workflows around variation management, claims intelligence, and project controls for major infrastructure and building projects.
 





 We are looking for a
 
**Senior Full\\-Stack Engineer** 

 who thrives in modern, distributed architectures and enjoys building scalable, production\\-grade systems.
 



**What You‚Äôll Do** 
* Design and build scalable
 
**GraphQL\\-first architectures** 

 using federated schemas across microservices
* Develop high\\-performance
 
**frontend applications** 

 using
 
**Next.js, React, and TypeScript**
* Build and maintain
 
**NestJS microservices** 

 , including guards, interceptors, and providers
* Implement
 
**GraphQL Federation** 

 (subgraphs, schema composition, entity references, query planning)
* Optimize system performance using batching, caching, and distributed tracing
* Work on
 
**event\\-driven systems** 

 using message queues
* Collaborate closely with product, data, and domain experts to ship meaningful features
* Contribute to architecture decisions, code reviews, and engineering best practices


**Core Technical Requirements** 
**Frontend** 
* Next.js (SSR, SSG, App Router)
* React.js \\& TypeScript
* Component\\-driven architecture and performance optimization


**Backend \\& APIs** 
* NestJS (modules, providers, guards, interceptors)
* GraphQL APIs and resolvers
* GraphQL Gateway / Federation (Apollo Federation, schema stitching, routing logic)
* Schema registry, versioning, and evolution strategies


**Microservices \\& Distributed Systems** 
* NestJS microservices with GraphQL endpoints
* Inter\\-service communication and service discovery
* Distributed systems patterns (circuit breaker, retries, data consistency)
* Error handling in federated environments


**Databases \\& Caching** 
* PostgreSQL (query optimization, migrations)
* ORMs: Prisma and/or TypeORM
* Redis caching strategies


**Event\\-Driven Architecture** 
* Message queues: RabbitMQ, AWS SQS, or Kafka



  




**Infrastructure \\& DevOps** 
* Docker, Docker Compose, multi\\-stage builds
* Monorepos using
 
**Turborepo or Nx**
* CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, Jenkins, or AWS CodePipeline)
* Git workflows, branching strategies, and code reviews


**Cloud \\& Security** 
* AWS services: Cognito, Amplify, EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, API Gateway
* Authentication \\& authorization: JWT, OAuth 2\\.0, AWS Cognito
* Rate limiting and security best practices


**Testing** 
* Unit testing: Jest, React Testing Library
* Integration \\& E2E testing: Cypress or Playwright


**What We‚Äôre Looking For** 
* 5\\+ years of experience in modern web and backend development
* Strong understanding of
 
**GraphQL Federation** 

 and distributed systems
* Experience building
 
**production\\-scale SaaS platforms**
* Strong ownership mindset and attention to detail
* Ability to work in a fast\\-moving, product\\-focused environment


**Why Join Novologic** 
* Build software used on
 
**real, large\\-scale infrastructure projects**
* Work on complex, high\\-impact technical problems
* Influence architecture and product direction early
* Competitive compensation and growth opportunities
* Collaborative, engineering\\-driven culture




 üì©
 
**Apply via LinkedIn or email your resume to:** 

 careers@novologic.co
 





 üåê
 
**Learn more:** 
 https://novologic.co
 



  





*Novologic is an equal opportunity employer.*

title: AI Computer Vision Intern
description:
**About Genyx** 




 Genyx is a deep tech fitness company building an AI movement intelligence platform for real\\-time coaching, performance optimisation, and injury risk reduction. Leveraging deep computer vision through camera\\-based systems, Genyx analyses human movement to deliver form correction, rep quality scoring, fatigue signals, and adaptive feedback. We work with premium gyms, wellness studios, hotels, and performance centres to bring scalable, data driven coaching into physical training environments without wearables.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 This is an AI / Computer Vision internship focused on building and optimising real\\-time movement analysis systems. You will work on pose detection, form analysis, and performance analytics, contributing directly to Genyx‚Äôs core product. The role involves close collaboration with the founding and research teams to solve real production problems in applied computer vision.
 



  





**Requirements** 




 Strong fundamentals in computer vision and machine learning, proficiency in Python, and experience with frameworks like PyTorch or TensorFlow. Familiarity with image processing, data analysis, and model optimisation is expected. Prior CV projects or interest in fitness and biomechanics is a plus.

title: Applications Engineer, Senior Engineer
description:
Top responsibilities for this position We are looking for a motivated and innovative candidate to join our team. Responsibilities to support and deploy STA sign\\-off solution include:
   

  

* Primary responsibilities as providing technical support to the top Synopsys customers on STA and ECO domains.
* Interact with product teams and R\\&D on improvement of the product and help with enhancement of the Product to cater customer advance tech needs
* Evaluate information needs of the users and develop creative solutions to address these needs.


 Technical/hard skills needed Candidate must have at least 3\\+ years of experience, preferably in the semiconductor domain, or overall, a mix of STA analysis, ECO, timing closure at block or Soc experience (2\\+ years as a STA/ECO engineer).
   

  

* Proficiency in Technical Support to effectively assist clients and resolve issues in Timing Signoff domain.
* Experience in PrimeTime and PrimeClosure/PTECO/Tweaker.
* Knowledge in Implementation is a plus.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Thorough understanding of technical writing processes.


 Soft skills and personality traits Good to have: Familiar with python and/or TCL scripting for automation.
   

  

* Functional knowledge of Linux or UNIX.


 Role and Team Overview:
   

  

 Role's contribution to Synopsys' success This is an exciting opportunity to be part of the Applications Engineering team that supports Synopsys Signoff (PrimeTime, PrimeClosure) Product platform. The primary focus in this role would be to provide technical support to the top Synopsys customers on STA and ECO domains that will aid in efficient adoption/usage of PrimeTime, PrimeClosure tool and its features by end users. This job involves cross\\-team collaboration and working closely with multiple organizations like R\\&D, Product Engineers, Application Engineers and Marketing teams. We‚Äôre looking for an Application Engineer to join our world\\-class AE team. You will help with providing technical and engineering insight and direction to improve usability, applicability, and adoption of Synopsys Signoff products, platforms, and solutions to meet the customer‚Äôs business needs. Does this sound like a good role for you?
   

  

 Core purpose and focus of the team
   

  

 Signoff Group is all about delivering comprehensive, high\\-performance, high\\-value solutions for VLSI Design and manufacturing to our customers while driving growth. Industry\\-leading PrimeTime \\& PrimeClosure platform is used by many chip\\-design companies as a STA sign\\-off \\& ECO solution at all technology nodes. PrimeTime platform is integrated into broader Synopsys Signoff products to accelerate design closure for manufacturing, by enabling independent sign\\-of\\-quality analysis and capabilities of ECO.
   

  

**We Are:**
 At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self\\-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high\\-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.
   

  

**You Are:**
 You are a passionate, resourceful, and innovative engineering professional who thrives in a fast\\-paced, collaborative environment. With a strong foundation in Static Timing Analysis (STA) and Engineering Change Order (ECO) flows, you are eager to apply your knowledge to support the world‚Äôs leading semiconductor companies. Your curiosity drives you to explore new technologies and solutions, and you are always ready to tackle complex technical challenges head\\-on. You take pride in your ability to communicate technical concepts clearly, both in writing and verbally, and you understand the importance of building strong relationships with customers and internal teams alike.
   

  

 You are motivated by a desire to make a tangible impact on the design and manufacturing of cutting\\-edge chips, and you enjoy the satisfaction that comes from helping customers solve their most pressing technical issues. Your experience with industry\\-standard tools such as PrimeTime, PrimeClosure, and PTECO/Tweaker sets you apart, and you are always looking for ways to enhance your skill set‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs through scripting, automation, or learning about the latest advancements in VLSI design. You are detail\\-oriented, proactive, and committed to continuous improvement, both for yourself and for the products you support.
   

  

 Above all, you are a collaborative team player who values diverse perspectives and believes in the power of innovation to drive positive change. If you are ready to contribute to a dynamic team that is shaping the future of electronic design, we want to hear from you.
   

  

**What You‚Äôll Be Doing:**
* Providing expert technical support to top Synopsys customers on STA and ECO domains, ensuring smooth adoption and optimal usage of PrimeTime and PrimeClosure solutions.
* Collaborating closely with product teams, R\\&D, and other stakeholders to relay customer feedback and contribute to the ongoing enhancement of our signoff tools.
* Evaluating customer requirements and developing creative, actionable solutions to address their unique technical challenges.
* Assisting users in troubleshooting timing signoff and closure issues, guiding them through best practices and advanced tool features.
* Creating and maintaining technical documentation, application notes, and knowledge base articles to empower users and streamline support processes.
* Developing and deploying automation scripts (Python, TCL) to improve support efficiency and enable customers to maximize productivity.
* Participating in cross\\-team initiatives and knowledge\\-sharing sessions to drive continuous improvement and foster a culture of innovation.


**The Impact You Will Have:**
* Accelerate the successful adoption of Synopsys PrimeTime and PrimeClosure tools by global customers, enabling faster time\\-to\\-market for their products.
* Enhance customer satisfaction through proactive, high\\-quality technical support and solution delivery.
* Drive continuous product improvement by channeling user feedback and real\\-world insights to R\\&D and product management teams.
* Strengthen Synopsys‚Äô reputation as a trusted technology partner and industry leader in signoff and ECO solutions.
* Empower customers to achieve higher performance, better quality, and more efficient design closure at advanced technology nodes.
* Contribute to the growth and success of the Applications Engineering team by sharing knowledge, mentoring colleagues, and fostering an inclusive, collaborative environment.


**What You‚Äôll Need:**
* At least 3\\+ years of experience in the semiconductor industry, with a focus on STA analysis, ECO flows, and timing closure at block or SoC level (minimum 2\\+ years as an STA/ECO engineer).
* Hands\\-on expertise with Synopsys PrimeTime and PrimeClosure/PTECO/Tweaker tools.
* Strong proficiency in providing technical support and guidance in the Timing Signoff domain.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a proven ability to convey complex technical information clearly.
* Solid understanding of technical writing processes and documentation standards.
* Familiarity with Linux or UNIX environments and basic scripting skills (Python and/or TCL) for automation is a plus.
* Knowledge of digital implementation flows and methodologies is desirable.


**Who You Are:**
* An analytical thinker with strong problem\\-solving skills and attention to detail.
* A collaborative team player who thrives in a diverse, cross\\-functional environment.
* Self\\-motivated, proactive, and eager to take ownership of challenges and opportunities.
* Adaptable and open to learning new tools, technologies, and methodologies.
* Excellent interpersonal skills, with a customer\\-centric mindset and a passion for delivering results.


**The Team You‚Äôll Be A Part Of:**
 You will join the high\\-performing Synopsys Signoff Group, a team dedicated to delivering comprehensive, high\\-value solutions for VLSI design and manufacturing. As part of the Applications Engineering team, you will work alongside experts in STA, ECO, and digital design, collaborating with R\\&D, product engineering, and marketing teams. The group is focused on accelerating design closure and enabling independent, high\\-quality analysis through the industry\\-leading PrimeTime and PrimeClosure platforms‚Äîtrusted solutions used by top chip design companies worldwide.
   

  

**Rewards and Benefits:**
 We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non\\-monetary offerings. Your recruiter will provide more details about the salary range and benefits during the hiring process.
company_industry: Semiconductor Manufacturing, Software Development, and Computer Hardware Manufacturing

title: GPU Development Engineer
description:
**Who We Are**
 Applied Materials is a global leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. We design, build and service cutting\\-edge equipment that helps our customers manufacture display and semiconductor chips ‚Äì the brains of devices we use every day. As the foundation of the global electronics industry, Applied enables the exciting technologies that literally connect our world ‚Äì like AI and IoT. If you want to push the boundaries of materials science and engineering to create next generation technology, join us to deliver material innovation that changes the world.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Location:
   

  

 Bangalore,IND, Pune,IND
   

  

 You‚Äôll benefit from a supportive work culture that encourages you to learn, develop, and grow your career as you take on challenges and drive innovative solutions for our customers. We empower our team to push the boundaries of what is possible‚Äîwhile learning every day in a supportive leading global company. Visit our Careers website to learn more.
   

  

 At Applied Materials, we care about the health and wellbeing of our employees. We‚Äôre committed to providing programs and support that encourage personal and professional growth and care for you at work, at home, or wherever you may go. Learn more about our benefits.
   

  

 As a Software Engineer at Applied Materials, you‚Äôll dive deep into ground\\-breaking technologies‚Äîlike machine learning and AI‚Äîto craft novel software solutions that solve our customers‚Äô high\\-value problems. Our Software Engineers are responsible for designing, prototyping, developing, and debugging software solutions for semiconductor equipment components and devices to ensure quality and functionality. You'll develop software documentation and test procedures, troubleshoot software problems, and communicate with internal customers to understand project requirements. As part of our team, you'll contribute your expertise in intricate systems, deciphering code, and anticipating software behaviors to ensure Applied remains the leader in the semiconductor and display sectors.
   

  

 We are seeking an expert GPU programmer to work on our multi\\-physics computational modeling codes. Your primary responsibility will be to extend the existing parallel processing capabilities in these codes for massive CPU\\-GPU parallelization. Your initial areas of focus will be models for radiation and ray\\-tracing, particle\\-tracking, chemical kinetics, fluid dynamics, turbulence, heat\\-transfer, plasma physics, solid mechanics, and their supporting infrastructures, especially iterative linear solvers.
   

  

**Essential Functions / Job Description**
 Develop CPU\\-GPU parallelization architectures for different multi\\-physics modules based on a deep understanding of the underlying solution algorithms, data flows, and memory usage of each module.
   

  

 Implement the parallel processing architectures designed for specific modules, and ensure high parallel efficiency through profiling, optimization, and tuning on the full suite of representative application cases.
   

  

 Re\\-design, refactor, and re\\-write existing Fortran 90 and C/C\\+\\+ computational physics modules to prepare them for GPU and hybrid parallelization.
   

  

 The development work will require involvement in all phases of the development lifecycle, including technical requirements definition, planning, software design, software implementation, testing, support, quality assurance, extension, maintenance, and documentation.
   

  

 Guide and participate in developing long\\-term roadmaps for hybrid parallelization using MPI, CUDA/OpenCL, and OpenMP of computational modeling codes at Applied Materials.
   

  

**Education And Skills / Job Requirements**
 An M.Sc, M.Tech, or PhD degree in computer science, applied mathematics, physics, or a computational modeling discipline, with emphasis on GPU parallelization and programming.
   

  

 Demonstrable talent and skill in software design, development, and testing. A high level of skill in profiling, debugging, and tuning GPU programs.
   

  

 A high level of proficiency in C/C\\+\\+, Python, CUDA, and OpenCL, and a readiness to learn other languages, such as Fortran 90\\.
   

  

 A high level of proficiency in MPI and OpenMP.
   

  

 Originality, creativity, and excellent problem\\-solving skills.
   

  

 Desire to learn about different computational physics modeling methods and technologies.
   

  

 Ability to work independently as well as in close collaboration with other computational scientists.
   

  

 The successful candidate will be a member of the Computational Products and Solutions Center of Excellence at Applied Materials. You will work with other talented and capable peers developing various modules of our flagship multi\\-physics software. The work environment is stimulating, collaborative, and rewarding, with good opportunities for learning, growth, and diversification of expertise and knowledge. You will work on difficult but solvable problems, and your work will have a far\\-reaching impact at Applied Materials, and hence on all of humanity. This position is ideal for someone with a passion for scientific computing, high\\-performance computing, and taking parallel processing techniques to their limits.
   

  

 Location
   

  

 The position is open in Applied Materials offices in Bengaluru or Pune.
   

  

**Additional Information**
**Time Type:**
 Full time
   

  

**Employee Type:**
 Assignee / Regular
   

  

**Travel:**
 Yes, 10% of the Time
   

  

**Relocation Eligible:**
 Yes
   

  

 Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high\\-performance silicon chips and software content. title: Senior Integration Engineer
description:
Design, build, and operate secure, reliable integrations and automated workloads that connect internal and external systems across the enterprise. This role ensures consistent data flow, API/service quality, and predictable batch processing operations that meet business SLAs. The engineer will work across modern integration platforms (iPaaS, API gateways, messaging systems) while leveraging workload automation tools for orchestration. Experience with MuleSoft is preferred but not required.
   

  

**Key Accountabilities**
**Integration Engineering (Any Integration Platform; MuleSoft Preferred):**
* Design, implement, and support APIs, integrations, and data flows using modern integration platforms (e.g., API gateways, ESBs, iPaaS).
* Apply established integration patterns (REST, SOAP, event‚Äëdriven, pub/sub, file‚Äëbased, batch) and enterprise design standards.
* Develop and maintain API specifications and integration documentation.
* Implement error handling, logging, observability, and integration‚Äëlevel SLAs.
* Stay current with integration platform capabilities and best practices.
* Preferred: Experience with MuleSoft (Anypoint Platform, API‚ÄëLed design, connectors, policies).


**Workload Automation (Control‚ÄëM Or Equivalent)**
* Configure, administer, and optimize enterprise workload automation tools (e.g., Control‚ÄëM, Airflow, Autosys, UC4\\).
* Build and maintain job flows, dependencies, calendars, and automated schedules.
* Migrate existing job chains from legacy or on‚Äëprem systems into modern scheduling platforms.
* Implement alerting, SLA management, runbooks, and job recovery strategies.
* Support operational readiness, including incident response and root‚Äëcause analysis.


**Shared Engineering Responsibilities**
* Contribute to CI/CD pipelines, deployment automation, and development workflows.
* Participate in peer reviews (code, job flows, API designs) to ensure quality standards are met.
* Create and maintain validation evidence, change records, and documentation required for regulated/validated environments.
* Collaborate with architecture, product teams, vendors, and operations to deliver secure, scalable solutions.
* Participate in on‚Äëcall rotation for integration and workload automation services.


**Skills**
* Strong understanding of modern integration concepts (API‚Äëled connectivity, eventing, asynchronous processing, API gateways, ESB/iPaaS solutions).
* Hands‚Äëon experience with at least one enterprise integration platform; MuleSoft preferred.
* Hands‚Äëon experience with one or more enterprise scheduling/orchestration tools (Control‚ÄëM strongly preferred).
* Proficiency with scripting or development languages (e.g., Java, Python, JavaScript).
* Familiarity with CI/CD tools (GitLab, Azure DevOps, Jenkins) and automated testing practices.
* Effective communication, collaboration, and vendor‚Äëengagement skills.


**Knowledge \\& Experience**
* 5‚Äì7\\+ years of integration engineering experience using enterprise integration technologies.
* Experience designing and operating APIs and integrations at scale.
* Experience supporting or administering job scheduling/workload automation solutions.
* Experience working in Agile environments and delivering high‚Äëquality, secure, and reliable services.
* Experience in regulated/validated environments (GxP, SDLC/Change Control) is a plus.
* Preferred: MuleSoft certifications or hands‚Äëon MuleSoft development/administration.


**Education Qualification**
* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Information Systems, or related field.

title: Principal Electrical Engineer
description:
Job Title: Principal Electrical Engineer
   

  

 Company: Tecnimont
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a Principal Electrical Engineer at Tecnimont, you will be responsible for leading electrical engineering projects from conception through completion while ensuring adherence to industry standards, quality, and safety. You will manage a team of engineers and collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to design, develop, and implement electrical systems and solutions for various engineering projects. Your expertise will guide project planning, execution, and troubleshooting, ensuring timely and cost\\-effective delivery.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead the design and implementation of electrical systems for industrial projects.
* Conduct feasibility studies and create technical specifications for electrical components and systems.
* Oversee the development of project plans, schedules, and budgets.
* Ensure compliance with relevant electrical codes and standards.
* Manage a team of electrical engineers, providing mentorship, guidance, and fostering professional development.
* Collaborate with project managers, clients, and stakeholders to define project requirements and deliverables.
* Perform risk assessments and implement mitigation strategies related to electrical systems.
* Review and approve engineering designs, documentation, and project deliverables.
* Monitor project progress and provide regular updates to senior management.
* Participate in site inspections and provide technical support during construction phases.


**Skills And Tools Required**
* Proven experience in electrical engineering design and project management.
* Strong understanding of electrical systems, components, and industry standards.
* Proficiency in electrical design software such as AutoCAD, ETAP, or similar tools.
* Excellent analytical and problem\\-solving skills.
* Strong leadership and team management abilities.
* Effective communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Familiarity with safety regulations and best practices in engineering.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.
* Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field; a Master's degree or Professional Engineer (PE) certification is preferred.
* Experience in industrial sectors (oil and gas, energy, etc.) is an advantage.


 If you are a dynamic electrical engineer looking to contribute to innovative projects and work with a talented team at Tecnimont, we encourage you to apply.
